title: Trump says Iran's supreme leader 'should be worried' about U.S. armada
shortDescription: Trump issued a new warning to Iran and its supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, ahead of expected talks over Tehran's nuclear program.

title: Trump calls Savannah Guthrie as search for her missing mother intensifies
shortDescription: The president called the "Today" co-anchor as the search for her missing mother in Arizona enters its fourth day.

title: Trump says he's using 'softer touch' on immigration after MN deaths
shortDescription: “I learned that maybe we could use a little bit of a softer touch. But you still have to be tough,” Trump told NBC News.

title: Melania Trump plugs her new movie as she meets with freed hostages
shortDescription: First lady Melania Trump plugged her new documentary as she met with freed Israeli-American hostages at the White House.

title: These 12 candidates are running to replace NJ's governor in Congress
shortDescription: Tom Malinowski, Tahesha Way, Joe Hathaway and nine others are in New Jersey's 11th congressional district race. Here's a guide to all the contenders.

title: Supreme Court rejects GOP request to block California congressional map
shortDescription: In a move that will make it harder for the GOP to keep control of Congress, the Supreme Court said the state can use a congressional map that favors Democrats.

title: Trump's new ballroom rendering shows a slight design change
shortDescription: The new triangular gable, which was first seen in renderings shared in July by the White House, sat atop six columns.

title: Man convicted of attempting to kill President Trump sentenced to life
shortDescription: A jury in September found Routh guilty of trying to kill the president at Trump International Golf Club in West Palm Beach, Florida, on Sept. 15, 2024.

title: Lee Hamilton, former congressman from Indiana, dies at age 94
shortDescription: Hamilton served for 34 years as a Democratic member of the U.S. House, forging deep friendships across the aisle with Republicans.

title: Trump says America should move on from Epstein files
shortDescription: Donald Trump says it's 'time for the country to move on' from the Jeffrey Epstein files, claiming 'nothing came out about me' after new documents were released.

title: First Amendment rights collided in a Minnesota church
shortDescription: Experts said the church protest and fallout over the arrests of journalists who covered it are among many First Amendment challenges in Minnesota.

title: Trump to sit for Super Bowl week interview with NBC News
shortDescription: President Trump will be interviewed by NBC News' Tom Llamas as part of a Super Bowl week tradition.

title: Trump scolds reporter for 'not smiling' after Epstein question
shortDescription: President Trump told Kaitlan Collins he's never seen her smile after the CNN anchor asked him about the Jeffrey Epstein files.

title: Leavitt says Trump believes in Constitution
shortDescription: The press secretary’s comments come after President Donald Trump called on Republicans to “nationalize” voting.

title: Would-be Trump assassin sentenced. Who is Ryan Routh?
shortDescription: Ryan Routh, found guilty of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump in September 2024, was sentenced to life in prison on Feb 4. What to know about him.

title: Trump clashes with reporter over Epstein question
shortDescription: President Donald Trump scolded a CNN reporter after she asked questions about the Department of Justice's recent release of Jeffrey Epstein files.

title: Nicki Minaj defends her support for Trump
shortDescription: In an exclusive clip from "The Katie Miller Podcast," obtained by Fox News, Nicki Minaj opens up about why she supports President Donald Trump.

title: The shutdown is over. Next up? A race to reform Trump's ICE
shortDescription: With the partial government shutdown over, all eyes in Congress are turning toward negotiations to reform ICE.

title: Trump doubles down on federal election intervention after pushback
shortDescription: During an event at the White House on Feb. 3, President Donald said the federal government "should get involved" in overseeing elections.
